ENGLISH: Direct immigration adds two new province buildings to the game. The province selector determines where pops will move from and the immigrator determines where pops will move to. Adjust decisions to choose whether you move primary, accepted, non accepted pops to other states or colonies.

We have began forcibly removing certain parts of our population from one region to another. There is a great deal of confusion, violence and conflict caused by government disruption of normal life in this state.

You can only build a maximum of five province selectors at any one time. Going over the limit will delete any surplus buildings. Unfortunately, this event may unavoidably spam if you have province selectors in construction, it will continue to do sountil your extra province selectors are built and can be cleared by the game. We have began forcibly removing certain parts of our population from one region to another. The target provinces are reasonably alarmed at this development, as well as the population that is being moved.

Welcome to Direct Migration Wiki, a short intro into direct migration campaigns in TGC mod. In short, with decisions that you unlock upon starting a DM campaign, you decide who you will move, and towards where. You can choose between primary, accepted, or non accepted cultures moving to state or colonial provinces. Exact emigration location (from where they will go) is decided by §GProvince Selector§!, and its target is decided by §GImmigrator Selectors§! (to where they are going). Decisions have been redone to more clearly explain what are you currently doing, and what you will be doing upon changing focus. Beware, maximum of province selectors is now §RFIVE§!. If you go over that, an event will clear any extra provinces you build. An option to move non-state religion population has also been added. When you decide to stop direct migration, enact migration options event and choose to end the campaign. Next time you wish to start it, merely re-enact the decision. If you accidentally build an immigrator where you did not wish to, or you wish to change it to another location, simply choose the option to clear all immigrators. Furthermore, if you started a campaign with this submod, you must not disable it, as it will mess up some basic game mechanics. It works vice versa, do not use the mod on already started campaigns.
